scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Nina
scrape.text: I was so intrigued by this story, the setup surrounding a dinner, and the parent/child angle, but every part of this fell flat for me. The pace of the story was so choppy, with most of the book being told in a stream-of-consciousness of Paul's thoughts and recollections. There was not enough of the real story interjected to move the mystery along. And I would never want to spend one minute, much less one evening, with ANY of these characters. Yech.
